conclusion: The distance between two objects is determined by the difference in the areas under their respective velocity-time graphs.
From the graph, the area under the graph for particle A is always greater than that for particle B.
Particle A is always ahead of particle B.
The difference in the areas under the graphs is greatest when the area under the graph for particle A is at its maximum and the area under the graph for particle B is at its minimum.
This occurs at t = 6t0, when the area under the graph for particle A is at its maximum and the area under the graph for particle B is at its minimum.
Therefore, the answer is option D.
